smartblocks.utilities
Interface Collider

All Known Implementing Classes:
BoxCollider, CircleCollider, PolygonCollider, PunctualCollider
public interface Collider

Interface used in order to check for collisions between blocks and objects

Author:
David FUENMAYOR

Method Summary
 void collide(MovingObject mo, Vector2D[] forces, Vector2D[] vertices)
          Converts the specified forces applied in the corresponding vertices into one single force applied in the centroid of the object and a torque.
 Vector2D[] getCollidingVertices(Block block, MovingObject object)
          Tells if the specified block and object collide, if so, returns array of colliding points whose coordinates are given with respect of the centroid of the block.
 

Method Detail

getCollidingVertices

Vector2D[] getCollidingVertices(Block block,
                                MovingObject object)
Tells if the specified block and object collide, if so, returns array of colliding points whose coordinates are given with respect of the centroid of the block.

Parameters:
block -
object -
Returns:
array of colliding points

collide

void collide(MovingObject mo,
             Vector2D[] forces,
             Vector2D[] vertices)
Converts the specified forces applied in the corresponding vertices into one single force applied in the centroid of the object and a torque. Uses MovingObject's addForces(...) method which only adds forces and torques to it. In order to apply the sum of the forces to the object use MovingObject's applyForces(...) afterwards.

Parameters:
mo -
forces -
vertices -
